properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 14 at 12:11PM EST until February 16 at 7:51AM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and
increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio...West
Virginia...

Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties.

For the Ohio River...Moderate flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River At Point Pleasant.
* Until Sunday morning.
* At 11:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 43.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 40.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending
at 11:00 AM EST Friday was 43.7 feet.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 44.0 feet
this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday
morning.
* Impact...At 44.0 feet, Homes at the end of 2nd Street outside the
flood wall in Point Pleasant are flooded. Little Kyger Gravel Hill
Road at Kyger Creek is flooded.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 43.9
feet on 12/25/1921.
properties.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive
cars through flooded areas.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.

NWSheadline: Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration until Sunday morning
